solution.text:
Given equations are :
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_
Pick 1st equation and write y in terms of x as follows
i.e.,_{j}_y = _{k}_-x
i.e.,y = \(_{k}_-x\over _{j}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of y in 2nd equation.
We get
_{i}_x - _{j}_(\(_{k}_-x\over _{j}_\)) = _{l}_
_{i}_x - (_{k}_-x) = _{l}_
_{i}_x - _{k}_ + x = _{l}_
_{{i+1}}_x = _{l}_+_{k}_
_{{i+1}}_x = _{{l+k}}_
x = \(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\)
Substituting this value of x in equation of y in terms of x
We get
y = \({_{k}_-{_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_}}\over _{j}_\)
y = \({{_{k}_\times _{{i+1}}_}-_{{l+k}}_}\over {_{j}_\times_{{i+1}}_}\)
y = \({_{{k*(i+1)}}_-_{{l+k}}_}\over _{{j*(i+1)}}_\)
y = \({_{{k*(i+1)-(l+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i+1)}}_\)
Therefore, x = \(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\) and y = \({_{{k*(i+1)-(l+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i+1)}}_\)

content.text:
Solve the following equation by the substitution method.
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_
